About me: Glass Instructor and glassblower for the last 7 years
Education: Graduated from Eleven Fifty's 12 week JavaScript Boot Camp in Fishers, Indiana. Attended December 4, 2018 through March 1, 2019. Upon Completion over 500 hours of hands on developing experience had been accrued.
Past Experience: Software Developer for CoResponsive, a startup located in Nobelsville, IN. Currently working on developing their initial product. Creating a web application, and Chrome extension using ReactJS. Will also be using NodeJS eventually on the API.

Software Engineer for https://HikerFeed.com which is resource for hikers to get information about towns and resources available on long-distance trails around the country. Also provides them a way to connect and stay connected when life on trail ends. The web app was built with Vue/Nuxt on the front end and PHP/Laravel on the backend.

Currently a teaching artist at the Indianapolis Art Center in the Glass studio. Where I teach the public about glass art and how to create it. I have taught there since February 2014. Responsibilities include managing my classroom, keeping students and the public informed about proper safety in the studio, assisting other artists, and keeping up on equipment maintenance.
